title: How a Genetic Trait in Black People Can Give the Police Cover
abstract: Sickle cell trait has been cited in dozens of police custody deaths ruled accidental or natural, even though the condition is benign on its own, a Times investigation found.
byline: By Michael LaForgia and Jennifer Valentino-DeVries

title: Why the C.D.C. Changed Its Advice on Masks
abstract: Two scientific findings altered the calculus: Vaccinated people don’t transmit the virus, and the shots are effective against variants.

smallThumb.caption: Masked and unmasked pedestrians walked around Manhattan on Friday.

title: ‘A Perpetual Motion Machine’: How Disinformation Drives Voting Laws
abstract: After former President Donald J. Trump undermined public confidence in elections, Republican lawmakers are defending voting restrictions by citing a lack of public confidence.

smallThumb.caption: A polling site in Adel, Iowa, on Oct. 5, the state’s first day of in-person voting. After the election, Iowa Republicans passed a law that limits early voting.
